parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The front end shimmy/wobble can cause loss of vehicle control, leading to accidents, especially at high speeds.
symptoms: The front end of the vehicle shakes or wobbles violently when driving over bumps
often at speeds above 45 mph. The steering wheel may shake or oscillate
making it difficult to control the vehicle.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the power steering pump can cause loss of power steering assist, making it difficult to steer the vehicle, especially at low speeds.
symptoms: causing the steering wheel to become difficult to turn or requiring increased effort to steer.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the steering box can cause loss of vehicle control, leading to accidents.
symptoms: causing the vehicle to veer to one side or lose control.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The sudden and violent shaking of the front end, known as the "death wobble," can cause loss of vehicle control, accidents, and potentially life-threatening situations.
symptoms: The front end of the vehicle shakes violently

often after hitting a bump at high speeds; the vehicle drifts into another lane; the vehicle bounces uncontrollably; the front end shimmying or wobbling; loud howling or noise coming from the front end.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The intermittent failure of the electronic throttle control can cause the engine to suddenly go to idle, resulting in a loss of power and control, which can lead to accidents or leave the driver stranded.
symptoms: The engine goes to idle with no response to the throttle pedal while driving
the throttle pedal has no effect on engine speed

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The repeated failure of the diesel engine can cause the vehicle to become stranded, leading to inconvenience, financial loss, and potential safety risks.
